pick east palo alto 
have that one space 



```{r}
#isolate bay area counties with 'membership' vector

bay_county_names <- 
  c(
    "Alameda",
    "Contra Costa",
    "Marin",
    "Napa",
    "San Francisco",
    "San Mateo",
    "Santa Clara",
    "Solano",
    "Sonoma"
  )

#cb=T is rough outline 
bay_counties <-
  counties("CA", cb = T, progress_bar = F) %>%
  filter(NAME %in% bay_county_names)

```

```{r}
#basic bay plot
ggplot(bay_counties) + geom_sf()
```

```{r}
# tigris places, need for HW-- palo alto specific. 

ca_cities <- places("CA", cb = T, progress_bar = FALSE)

# now correspond the cities (above) with the counties from earlier, with brackets in sf function (specialized for this specific tool (sf), ususally only use brackets for rows and columns of data frams. ) 

bay_cities <- ca_cities[bay_counties, ]

```

```{r}

#then you map it

mapview(bay_counties, alpha.regions = 0) + mapview(bay_cities)

#caveate- adjacent/touching cities to the selected places are kept in this approach. but are NOT in these counties. 

# this is a basic framework. 

# to fix this touching thing,. use a pipe that overlaps/instesects based on the 'centroids' of the cities. 

#this will now exclude the cities touching the counties while keeping these cities within and labeling the cities as well.  

bay_cities_within <-
  ca_cities %>% 
  st_centroid() %>% 
  .[bay_counties, ] %>% 
  st_set_geometry(NULL) %>% 
  left_join(ca_cities %>% select(GEOID)) %>% 
  st_as_sf()

#the "." before [bay_counties] tells the pipe where to put the object ca_cities/how you want it to be received. 
```

```{r}
#graph this specified data graph with bay cities within now instead of bay cities. 

mapview(bay_counties, alpha.regions = 0) + mapview(bay_cities_within, label = "NAME")
```

```{r}
#leaflet is op 

leaflet() %>% 
  addTiles() %>% 
  addPolygons(
    data = bay_counties,
    fill = F,
    weight = 2,
    label = ~NAME
  ) %>%
  addPolygons(
    data = bay_cities %>% 
      filter(!GEOID %in% bay_cities_within$GEOID),
    color = "red",
    label = ~NAME
  ) %>% 
  addPolygons(
    data = bay_cities_within,
    color = "green",
    label = ~NAME
  )

```

```{r}
pge_20_res_elec <-
  pge_20_elec %>% 
  filter(CUSTOMERCLASS == "Elec- Residential") %>% 
  mutate(
    ZIPCODE = ZIPCODE %>% as.character()
  ) %>% 
  group_by(ZIPCODE) %>% 
  summarize(
    TOTALKWH = sum(TOTALKWH, na.rm = T)
  ) %>% 
  right_join(
    bay_zips %>% select(GEOID10),
    by = c("ZIPCODE" = "GEOID10")
  ) %>% 
  st_as_sf() %>% 
  st_transform(4326)
```

```{r}

#race 2020

dec_vars_2020 <-
  listCensusMetadata(
    name = "2020/dec/pl",
    type = "variables"
  )

smc_pop_race_2020 <-
  getCensus(
    name = "dec/pl",
    vintage = 2020,
    region = "block:*", 
    regionin = "state:06+county:081",
    vars = "group(P1)"
  ) %>% 
  mutate(
    block =
      paste0(state,county,tract,block)
  ) %>% 
  select(!c(GEO_ID,state,county,tract,NAME) & !ends_with(c("NA"))) %>% 
  pivot_longer(
    ends_with("N"),
    names_to = "name",
    values_to = "estimate"
  ) %>%
  left_join(
    dec_vars_2020 %>% 
      select(name, label)
  ) %>% 
  select(-name) %>% 
  separate(
    label,
    into = c(NA,NA,"category1","category2"),
    sep = "!!"
  )


#race 2010

dec_vars_2010 <-
  listCensusMetadata(
    name = "2010/dec/pl",
    type = "variables"
  )

 smc_pop_race_2010 <-
  getCensus(
    name = "dec/pl",
    vintage = 2010,
    region = "block:*", 
    regionin = "state:06+county:081",
    vars = "group(P1)"
    ) %>% 
    transmute(
    block =
      paste0(county,tract,block),
    pop = P001001
    ) %>% 
  mutate(
    block =
      paste0(county,tract,block)
  ) %>% 
  select(!c(state,county,tract,block) & !ends_with(c("NA"))) %>% 
  pivot_longer(
    ends_with("N"),
    names_to = "name",
    values_to = "estimate"
  ) %>%
  left_join(
    dec_vars_2010 %>% 
      select("name", "label")
  ) %>% 
  select(-"name") %>% 
  separate(
    label,
    into = c(NA,NA,"category1","category2"),
    sep = "!!"
  )
 
 dec_vars_2020 %>% 
  filter(grepl("P1",name)) %>% 
  select(name, label) %>% 
  arrange(name)
```

```{r}
      TRUE ~ ""
```
